title.narrative: NON FINANCIAL CONTRIBUTIONS

description.narrative: Increased non-financial contributions from individual donors, private and public sector partners for the realization of boys' and girls' rights., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Education â€“ General, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Private Sector Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, engaged citizens, including boys, girls and families, millennials, individual donors and private sector partners, are driving public action for the realization of children's rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased non-financial contributions from individual donors, private and public sector partners for the realization of boys? andgirls? rights.

description.narrative: Through the One Million Opportunities (1MiO) initiative, UNICEF Brazil has engaged 121 organizations and institutions, including 66 private sector companies non-financially, between October 2020 and November 2021 to offer decent job opportunities in the categories of apprenticeship, internship, formal employment, and skills development training to vulnerable youth aged 14 to 24. A total of 26 million young people between 14 and 24 years were reached by the initiative during this period and 239,111 accessed opportunities on the 1MiO platform. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2022
